content.description:
Relationship of Driving Test Scores and Family Income

The line graph has 10 data points. 

The values are approximate.

The data for the line graph are as follows:

Less than $20,000: Test score 120

$20,000 to $40,000: Test score 128

$40,000 to $60,000: Test score 139

$60,000 to $80,000: Test score 146

$80,000 to $100,000: Test score 152 

$100,000 to $120,000: Test score 159

$120,000 to $140,000: Test score 161

$140,000 to $160,000: Test score 165

$160,000 to $200,000: Test score 168

More than $200,000: Test score 180
content.question: A researcher gave a group of college students a driving test and then collected data about their household income. Using the information in the graph, which of the following statements is most accurate?

choices.label: Having a higher driving test score causes students to have a higher family income.
There is a positive correlation between family income and driving test scores.
Having a higher family income causes students to have higher driving test scores.
There is a negative correlation between family income and driving test scores.

content.answer: There is a positive correlation between family income and driving test scores.

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
